intro: Anisophyllum novomexicanum, commonly known as the New Mexico fern, is a unique plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Pteridaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like fronds. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are often divided into narrow, linear segments, giving it a distinctive appearance. Anisophyllum novomexicanum plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
